availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Quincy Adams King (Paducah (McCracken co) attorney)

body.p: Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Leann S. King. Father of Mary E. King, Nancy S. King, Elen H. King, and Leann King. Attended Princeton University. Elected to the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1856. Speaker of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1857.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burkesville, stamped p. 280. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah District 2, p. 134. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Colorado, Arapahoe County, District 1, p. 27.Journal of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky (Frankfort: A. G. Hodges, 1856), 3. George Mason Graham Stafford, The King Family of Virginia, Geneaology, 1350-1950 (Genealogical Society of Utah, 1971), microfilm reproduction of typescript, 28-29.
